snippet: When Dania al-Betar began her school for Syrian refugees in January 2011, she had only 16 students. Now, she has more than 1,600.
abstract: When Dania al-Betar began her school for Syrian refugees in January 2011, she had only 16 students. Now, she has more than 1,600.

headline.main: A School for Syrian Refugees, 'Shouting for Help'
